ch.epfl.lasec.mova
Class YGroupElement

java.lang.Object
  ch.epfl.lasec.mova.YGroupElement

public class YGroupElement
extends java.lang.Object

Class representing the elements of the YGroup. In this implementation YGroup is {-1,+1} It is represented by a boolean

Author:
Sebastien Duc

encodeYGroupElementSequence

public static byte[] encodeYGroupElementSequence(YGroupElement[] sequence)
Method used to encode a sequence of YGroupElements into a array of bytes

Each element takes only one bit but the number of elements in the sequence is not always a multiple of 8, so we have to pad 0. We use 1 byte to encode pad_length
........................................................................
| pad_length | 0 padding | seqence[length_sequence -1] ... sequence[0] |
''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''
One are represented by a bit set to 1 and minus one are represented by a bit set to 0.

Parameters:
sequence - Sequence of YGroupElement to encode
Returns:
Returns the encoded sequence as an array of bytes

decodeEncodedYGroupElementSequence

public static YGroupElement[] decodeEncodedYGroupElementSequence(byte[] encodedSequence)
Method used to decode an sequence of YGroupElements that was previously encoded using method encodeYGroupElementSequence.

Parameters:
encodedSequence - The encoded sequence of YGroupElements represented as an array of bytes
Returns:
Returns the sequence of YGroupElements as an array of YGroupElements

pow

public YGroupElement pow(int p)
Compute the power of p of the YGroupElement
g.pow(p) = gp
In this implementation YGroup = {-1,+1}, so (+1)^p = +1 and (-1)^p = -1 when p is odd and +1 when p is even

Parameters:
p -
Returns:
Returns an YGroupElement which is g^p
